ygData.subject: Re: Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Bree, ... I too dislike the notion of item hoarding, and would not take a piece of loot that someone else needed.  Up until about level 39 I was still wearing
ygData.messageBody:
Bree,

>Well, personally When I am playing I am hunting. I work FT and by the time
>I get on at night, we have to try and get together and do something before
>someone has to go to bed, the weekends are a different story. I do spend
>time helping others out and going into town and such. I don't get much
>time for "travel" and nice as it may seem to have a different outfit, My
>group does not get items we do not need. There is enough camping for items
>in the game now as it stands and for my group to camp a Mithril BP for me
>"for looks" is not what we practice. I had a pair of ruby pants in the bank
>but honestly i can't be bothered with carrying all that stuff around all the
>time, just to impress people.

I too dislike the notion of item hoarding, and would not take a piece of
loot that someone else needed. Up until about level 39 I was still wearing
a Lockjaw Vest, and although a sturdy piece of dress, was extremely lacking
in terms of appearance. Fortunately, on the same day nonetheless, my group
I hunt with regularly looted a Mithril BP, and not half an hour I was able
to finally trade for a Bloodstained tunic, after looking for one for over 25
levels. Bascially in travel mode I wear a Mithril BP and Mithril wrists,
and the rest is Rubicite (except for the helm those are icky). During
battle I will take off my Mith bp for my BS Tunic, Rubi Legs for my Gator
legs, and Rubi Arms for my plat armband. It's a horrid look but I've found
that in delf form it's not so bad. There's really no bothere in carrying
those 3 pieces of equipment, even the weight isn't so bad in all honesty.

I fear you may confuse personal vanity with wanting to impress people. I
don't wear my travel clothes because I want to impress people, I don that
garb, simply because it's aethestically pleasing to mine eyes. Pure and
simple, I just want to look as best as I can, for my own tastes.

>My point being, that if they we going to make items for us to increase our
>wisdom stats I think the designers could have done a better job of trying to
>make them match for our class specifically.

I'd agree with this.. much the way fear armor is geared to each class
statwise in most cases. It's unfornate that the rest of the time you'll be
a walking hodgepodge, until you can attain a full suit of fear armor,
especially since fear is close to impossilbe to breach.

>Also, just my opinion Human females look like ass in Steel plate and/or
>bronze armor. Full ruby and Mithril and the mist armor I like, but the
>others don't appeal to me what so ever.

I personally don't like bronze meself, I can't stand the way any of the
plated helms look either. But a full suit of Steel, Rubi, Mith, or Mist is
eye pleasing to me, sans the helms. ;)

-Aosinator Lightbringer
-Devout follower of Mithaniel Marr on The Rathe
